com.pb.sawdust.io

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.io.FileUtil

  • public class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileUtil class provides static convenience methods for dealing with files and directories. It mainly wraps methods calls in java.io.File.

    • Method Detail

      • getLineSeparator

        public static java.lang.String getLineSeparator()
        Get the line separator/terminator for the platform the JVM is running on.
        Returns:
        this platform's line terminator.

      • getLineSeparator

        public static java.lang.String getLineSeparator(java.io.File file)
        Get the line separator for a specified file. This method checks only the first line of the file to make the determination, and if only one line (sans a line terminator) exists in the file, then the result of getLineSeparator() is returned.
        Parameters:
        file - The file in question.
        Returns:
        the line separator used in the file, or the default line separator if no determination could be made.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exist.

      • getLineSeparator

        public static java.lang.String getLineSeparator(java.lang.String file)
        Get the line separator for a specified file. This method checks only the first line of the file to make the determination, and if only one line (sans a line terminator) exists in the file, then the result of getLineSeparator() is returned.
        Parameters:
        file - The file in question.
        Returns:
        the line separator used in the file, or the default line separator if no determination could be made.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file does not exist.

      • deleteFile

        public static boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String path)
        Delete a file.
        Parameters:
        path - The path specifying the file to delete.
        Returns:
        true if the file was deleted successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path does not represent a file.

      • emptyDir

        public static boolean emptyDir(java.lang.String path)
        Empty a directory without deleting it. If the directory contains subdirectories, then those subdirectories are recursively emptied, but not deleted.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to empty.
        Returns:
        true if the directory was emptied successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path does not represent a directory.

      • emptyDir

        Empty a directory without deleting it. If the directory contains subdirectories, then those subdirectories are recursively emptied, but not deleted.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory to empty.
        Returns:
        true if the directory was emptied successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dir is not a directory.

      • clearDir

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • copyFile

        public static boolean copyFile(java.io.File sourceFile,
               java.io.File destFile,
               boolean overwrite)
        Copy a file.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The source file to copy.
        destFile - The destination file.
        overwrite - If true, destFile will be overwritten if it exists. If false, then destFile will not be overwritten and this method will return false.
        Returns:
        true if the file was copied successfully, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sourceFile does not exist.

      • copyFile

               java.lang.String destFile,

        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The source file to copy.
        destFile - The destination file.
        overwrite - If true, destFile will be overwritten if it exists. If false, then destFile will not be overwritten and this method will return false.
        Returns:
        true if the file was copied successfully, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sourceFile does not exist.

      • copyDir

        public static void copyDir(java.io.File sourceDir,
           java.io.File destDir,
           java.io.FileFilter filter)
        Copy an entire directory to a new location. Anything that does not pass through the provided file filter will not be copied. sourceDir will be copied to new File(destDir,sourceDir.getName()); that is, the source directory is copied, not just its contents.
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - The source directory.
        destDir - The destination directory.
        filter - Filter to specify if a file/folder should be copied or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either sourceDir or destDir is not a directory or does not exist.

      • copyDir

        public static void copyDir(java.lang.String sourceDir,
           java.lang.String destDir,
           java.io.FileFilter filter)
        Copy an entire directory to a new location. Anything that does not pass through the provided file filter will not be copied. sourceDir will be copied to new File(destDir,sourceDir.getName()); that is, the source directory is copied, not just its contents.
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - The source directory.
        destDir - The destination directory.
        filter - Filter to specify if a file/folder should be copied or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either sourceDir or destDir is not a directory or does not exist.

      • copyDir

        public static void copyDir(java.io.File sourceDir,
           java.io.File destDir)
        Copy an entire directory to a new location. sourceDir will be copied to new File(destDir,sourceDir.getName()); that is, the source directory is copied, not just its contents. Any previously existing files will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - The source directory.
        destDir - The destination directory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either sourceDir or destDir is not a directory or does not exist.

      • copyDir

        public static void copyDir(java.lang.String sourceDir,
           java.lang.String destDir)
        Copy an entire directory to a new location. sourceDir will be copied to new File(destDir,sourceDir.getName()); that is, the source directory is copied, not just its contents. Any previously existing files will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - The source directory.
        destDir - The destination directory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either sourceDir or destDir is not a directory or does not exist.

      • move

        public static boolean move(java.io.File originalPath,
           java.io.File newPath)
        Move a file or directory to a new location. This is just a wrapper for File.renameTo(File). This method does not allow a destination file/dir to be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        originalPath - The origin file.
        newPath - The new file.
        Returns:
        true if the move was successful, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if originalPath does not exist or newPath already exists.

      • move

        public static boolean move(java.lang.String originalPath,
           java.lang.String newPath)
        Move a file or directory to a new location. This method does not allow a destination file/dir to be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        originalPath - The origin file.
        newPath - The new file.
        Returns:
        true if the move was successful, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if originalPath does not exist or newPath already exists.

        public static java.io.FileFilter fileFilter(java.io.FilenameFilter filter)
        Get a file filter from a filename filter.
        Parameters:
        filter - The input filter.
        Returns:
        a file filter wrapping filter.

      • getTransparentFileFilter

        public static java.io.FileFilter getTransparentFileFilter()
        Get a "transparent" file filter which allows all files through.
        Returns:
        a file filter accepting all files.

      • openFile

        public static java.io.BufferedReader openFile(java.io.File file)
        Get a BufferedReader to use to read a specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to use with the reader.
        Returns:
        a buffered reader which can be used to read file.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if file is not found.

      • openFile

        public static java.io.BufferedReader openFile(java.io.File file,
                              java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Get a BufferedReader to use to read a specified file with a specific character encoding.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to use with the reader.
        charset - The character set to use when reading this file.
        Returns:
        a buffered reader which can be used to read file.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if file is not found.
